intro: Phacelia subsinuata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Phacelia subsinuata is also valued as a nectar source for bees and other pollinators.
